definition: to walk right into the trap
self/oneself/from/since/naturally/surely
to cast/to send/to throw oneself (into the river etc)/to seek refuge/to place oneself into the hands of
gauze/to collect/to gather/to catch/to sift
surname Luo
net/network

sentences.english: We set an Ambush on all sides, waiting for the enemy to come into the trap.
sentences.chinese: 我們設下十面埋伏，專等敵人自投羅網。
沒有罪犯願意自投羅網。

sentences.english: If she is the bait in the trap, I'm willing to spring it.
sentences.chinese: 即使她是圈套裏的誘餌，我也甘願自投羅網。

definition: to whisper to one another's ear
without a retreat route/caught in a dead end/having burned one's bridges
lit. helping tyrant Zhou 商紂王|商纣王[Shang1 Zhou4 wang2] in his oppression (idiom)/fig. to take the side of the evildoer/giving succor to the enemy
to have no sense of shame/brazen
daring/presumptuous/daredevil
masquerade
to take advantage of one's position to bully people (idiom)/to kick people around
protective coloration/camouflage
to nod one's head and bow (idiom); bowing and scraping/unctuous fawning
lit. spouting smoke through the seven orifices (idiom)/fig. to seethe with anger
overbearing/arrogant bully
to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end

definition: doddering/senile
to take the blame for sb else/to compensate for one's crime/to get charges dropped (by paying money etc)
